title: AME&T font
content:
I’m sure this is an obvious one but really havent got the slightest idea what it is and have to re-do it for offset. Any help greatly appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085153im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_3611.jpg)

 [‹ Furnish - Book Title Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085153/http:/typophile.com/node/40599 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID REQ - Vidid Europe, perfectly circular O, different stressed stroke V ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085153/http:/typophile.com/node/40546 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sihep

comments.content:
The ’AMET’ looks similar to [Kabel](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085153/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-kabel/), but the ’&’ is from something else. Do you need ’Group’ too? (not Kabel). Seeing it in test drive, I guess Kabel’s A is not quite as wide, but it might give you something to work with.

- Mike Yanega

The ’&’ looks a lot like Goudy, especially [Goudy Oldstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085153/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-goudy-oldstyle/).

- Mike Yanega
Great! I had been looking for just one typeface and was getting very confused. Many thanks for that.

Arrus BT for the ampersand, Trebuchet for the Group bit and Kabel Book BT for the rest as Mike has said.

Source: [http://www.amet-group.co.uk/AMET-PBT.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080110085153/http:/www.amet-group.co.uk/AMET-PBT.pdf "http://www.amet-group.co.uk/AMET-PBT.pdf")
That’s 100% perfect now - sorry i missed that pdf (the others are broken links). Thank you both for your help.
